DOC.brief_summary: We conduct trial determine whether paclitaxel/cisplatin ( TP ) adjuvant chemotherapy radical surgery improve disease-free survival ( DFS ) overall survival ( OS ) , well quality life ( QoL ) among early-stage ( FIGO stage IB-IIA ) cervical cancer patient risk factor .
DOC.brief_title: A Multicenter , Prospective , Randomized Trial Adjuvant Chemotherapy Early-Stage Cervical Cancer Patients
DOC.criteria: FIGO stage : ⅠB～ⅡA , cervical cancer ; Age≤60 year ; female , Chinese woman ; Initial treatment radical hysterectomy + pelvic lymph node dissection ; Pathological diagnosis : cervical squamous cell invasive carcinoma ; Pathologic examination meet follow one indication adjuvant therapy : ① lymph node metastasis , ② parametrial invasion , ③ ≥ 2/3 deep stromal invasion , ④ histopathological grade poorly differentiate ( G2 G3 ) , ⑤ lymphatic vascular space involvement , ⑥ tumor diameter > 4cm ; Laboratory test : WBC≥4×10 ( 9 ) /L , NEU≥2×10 ( 9 ) /L , PLT≥80×10 ( 9 ) /L , serum bilirubin≤ 1.5 time upper limit normal , transaminase≤ 1.5 time upper limit normal , BUN , Cr≤ normal Performance status : Karnofsky score≥60 ; No prior treatment ; Receiving extensive resection uterus ( type III ) plus pelvic lymph node wide resection ; pathologically diagnose cervical squamous cell carcinoma ; Provide write informed consent .
